thought: Attended robotics club meeting; noted new FPGA board specs.
Reviewed capacitor coupling issues in analog circuit.
Sketched a decoupling network with 100 nF and 1 µF capacitors near every VCC pin.
Read Xilinx app-note on split-plane PCB stack-ups for Zynq FPGAs.
Wondered if LC filters on VCCINT introduce too much impedance at 200 MHz switching.
Measured core-rail ripple: 38 mV pp while running CNN inference bitstream.
Noticed thermal hotspot near DDR interface; consider copper pour on inner layer.
Thought about switching to PoL regulators with remote sense for better load-step response.
Recalled mentor’s advice: “One decap per power pin, lowest ESL wins.”
